item.title: 64-bit
item.description: Make Houdini process data in 64-bit This is a write up of Jeff Lait’s masterclass about 64-bit Processing in Houdini.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there! Im currently working as an FX TD and created this page to document and share workflows, ideas and notes about houdini and various other vfx topics as well as my recent deep learning adventures.

item.title: Abusing Heightfields as Fast Image Canvas
item.description: The Problem A big part of getting a machine learning model to run is to prepare and import the data in the right shape.

item.title: Collisions
item.description: Performance To avoid regenerating collision geometry / vdbs of a moving but nondeforming object it makes sense to avoid SOP level animation and only animate on OBJ level and use the transform to move the collider in the DOP network.

item.title: Exporting Image Sequences
item.description: set your timeline in and out options to the desired length drop down a Movie File Out TOP and choose image sequence put the following snippet as an expression in the file path 1 'myImgSeq' + me.

item.title: Feedback Loops
item.description: Like a [[notes/SOP Solver |SOP Solver]] in Houdini! The setup is a little different but the same logic applies. A TOP feedback loop is regularly used to blur, fade or transform pixels like you usually do with attributes in Houdini.

item.title: FLIP
item.description: General Particle Velocity vs Volume Velocity It’s hard to have exact art directible control over the FLIP particles when working with volume velocities.

item.title: General Workflow Tips
item.description: Temporary Attributes When creating HDAs or working on bigger setups it might make sense to prefix any temporary attributes with a special character such as __ to make removing it later on easier e.

item.title: Houdini And Nuke To TouchDesigner
item.description: TouchDesigner was born as a fork of [[notes/Houdini |Houdini]] 4.1, which shows in some methodologies and naming conventions. From a [[notes/Nuke |Nuke]] compositing standpoint there are many similarities when it comes to 2D image manipulation as well.

item.title: Houdini Crash Issue when using Virtual Displays with Parsec
item.description: To prevent the crash add the following line to your houdini.env. 1 HOUDINI_USE_HFS_OCL=0 sources / further reading:

item.description: Basics Dimensions Houdini most commonly uses 3x3 or 4x4 matrices to store transformation data 3x3 -> rotation and scale 4x4 -> rotation, scale and translation

item.title: Wave Expressions
item.description: Useful Periodic Functions I recently stumbled across this phenomenal summary of wave expressions by Cameron Carson. Check it out! He wrote everything for Nuke so I decided to build a similar little library for VEX and adjust the necessary syntax / functions.
